licence_overview:
$! To run a nursing agency in Northern Ireland you must register it, meet certain standards and operate according to the current regulations. $!

The minimum standards make sure the agency is managed properly and provides quality care.

$D [Download 'Nursing agencies: minimum standards' (PDF, 216KB)](http://www.rqia.org.uk/cms_resources/Nursing%20Agencies%20Standards%20Jul%2008.pdf "Download 'Nursing agencies: minimum standards' (PDF, 216KB)"){:rel="external"} $D

The rules for nursing agencies can be found in [The Nursing Agencies Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005](http://www.legislation.gov.uk/nisr/2005/175/contents/made "The Nursing Agencies Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005"){:rel="external"}

## Restrictions

If you want to operate or manage more than one agency you must make a separate application for each one.

## How to register

You must register with the Health and Social Care Regulation and Quality Improvement Authority (RQIA) using the following form: 

$D [Download 'Application for registration' (PDF, 100KB)](http://www.rqia.org.uk/cms_resources/APPLICATION%20FOR%20REGISTRATION%20R%20I%20.pdf "Download 'Application for registration' form (PDF, 100KB)"){:rel="external"} $D

You must pay a registration fee of £30 and an annual fee of £15.

## Fines and penalties

If you don't register, don't meet the minimum standards or break the regulations, you could be taken to court.
licence_short_description: Registration needed to operate a nursing agency in Northern Ireland
overview: If you operate a nursing agency in Northern Ireland you must meet certain minimum standards and be officially registered
title: Nursing agency registration (Northern Ireland)
